'''Solosis''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ユニラン''' ''Uniran'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] into {{p|Duosion}} starting at [[level]] 32, which evolves into {{p|Reuniclus}} starting at level 41.

==Biology==
Solosis is a round, green Pokémon surrounded by a darker green, gel-like substance. This liquid covering allows Solosis to live under any conditions. Its inner body has dark, oval eyes and a red diamond-shaped mouth. On the upper left side of its head is a curly, yellow growth that resembles the endoplasmic reticulum of a cell. It uses psychic powers to communicate with telepathy, as well as to drive away potential threats.

==In the anime==
[[File:Doyle Solosis.png|250px|thumb|left|Solosis in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Solosis debuted in ''[[BW035|Where Did You Go, Audino?]]'', under the ownership of [[Doyle]].

An army of Solosis and {{p|Duosion}} appeared in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]'', under the ownership of [[Damon]].

===Minor appearances===
A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Solosis appeared in ''[[XY039|Summer of Discovery!]]'', ''[[XY041|Foggy Pokémon Orienteering!]]'', and ''[[XY042|Battling Into the Hall of Fame!]]''.

A Solosis appeared in ''[[XY092|Cloudy Fate, Bright Future!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Psychic}}.

===Pokédex entries===
{{Animedexheader|Unova}}
{{Animedexbody|BW035|Solosis|Ash's Pokédex|Solosis, the Cell Pokémon. A membrane filled with fluid surrounds Solosis's body which allows it to live anywhere. It defeats its enemies using its formidable Psychic-type powers.}}
{{Animedexfooter/Pokémon|''Best Wishes''|Unova}}

==In the manga==
[[File:White Solly Solosis.png|thumb|150px|Solosis in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A Solosis is one of the Pokémon employed by the [[BW Agency]]. It first appeared in ''[[PS482|To Make a Musical]]''

A Trainer's Solosis appeared in ''[[PS466|An Odd Speech]]'' and [[PS535]].

A Solosis was among several Pokémon attracted to [[Alder]]'s wrestling match with his {{p|Bouffalant}} in [[Nimbasa City]] in ''[[PS487|A New Perspective]]''.

{{adv|White}} caught a Solosis during her [[Battle Subway]] training sometime prior to ''[[PS500|With a Little Help from My Friends]]'', which was later nicknamed Solly. It later evolved into a Duosion.

A Solosis liberated by [[Team Plasma]] appeared in a flashback in ''[[PS529|Pokédex Lecture]]''.

===In the Pokémon RéBURST manga===
Solosis is one of the Pokémon [[Pauline]] uses to help run and maintain the [[Burst Heart Survival]] tournament. It uses {{m|Psychic}} to confiscate the [[Burst|Burst Hearts]] of the losers.

==Trivia==
* Solosis is tied with {{p|Abra}} for the highest {{stat|Special Attack}} of all unevolved Pokémon.
* Solosis and {{p|Gothita}}'s evolution branch can be considered parallel. Both are [[Generation V]] Pokémon evolving once at level 32 then at level 41. Solosis' family branch can only be found in Pokémon White and Pokémon White 2, while Gothita can only be found in Pokémon Black and Pokémon Black 2. They are both Psychic-type Pokémon with similar base experience and catch rates, they gain new moves at similar levels, and they have base stat totals of 290.

===Origin===
Solosis and the rest of its evolutionary line seem to bear reference to {{wp|Cell (biology)|cells}}, with the head representing the {{wp|Nucleus|nucleus}}, the green substance surrounding their bodies resembling {{wp|cytoplasm}} and the objects inside their bodies representing {{wp|Organelle|organelles}}. The line down its head also resembles a {{wp|cleavage furrow}} in cell biology. It may also make allusion to the {{wp|Embryogenesis|embryonary stages}}, specifically the stage of {{wp|morula}}.

====Name origin====
Solosis may be a combination of ''solo'' (singular) and ''{{wp|meiosis}}'' or ''{{wp|mitosis}}'' (cell division).

Uniran may be a combination of ''uni'' (prefix meaning ''one'') and 卵 ''ran'' (spawn). It may also refer to ''se unirán'' (Spanish for "they will join together"), as Solosis appears to be made of two parts.
